newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KLI unit gets nod for share issue.
newsitem.headline: KLI unit gets nod for share issue.

text.p: Malaysia's Securities Commission has approved the issue of new shares in Malaysia Electric Corporation Bhd, a subsidiary of Kuala Lumpur Industries Holdings Bhd (KLI), KLI said on Monday.
KLI, in a statement sent by its merchant bank, Malaysian International merchant Bankers Bhd (MIMB), said the issue consists of 21 million new shares, representing 30 percent of Malaysia Electric.
The stock will be taken up by the government's investment arm Khazannah Holdings Bhd for 128 million ringgit, said MIMB.
Malaysia Electric is involved in the development of a 1.6 billion ringgit project to build a township on Malaysia's east coast to make electrical appliances.
Known as the MEC City, the project is the brainchild of Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad. The project was launched in March.
